title: Administrative
description:
POSITION CONCEPT:
Administrative /Print Role

This position is responsible for satisfying customer requirements with administrative duties within a single customer location.
In this role, the individual is responsible for assisting with administrative duties and works independently to facilitate quality control so the customer receives a perfect job. Assisting all customers in a manner that meets or exceeds expectations.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:
Establish and Maintain high levels of Customer Satisfaction

Responsibilities
Customer interaction, ie visitors & couriers
Switchboard, answering incoming calls
Receive mail and distribute to staff
Arrange courier, sending & receiving
Ordering office supplies
Record keeping of submitted and outputted customer jobs
Customer billing via internal system, ie Meridian
Quality assurance, checks of completed jobs
Job requisitions into Canada Post ESOM software

QUALIFICATIONS:
Experience with the following equipment & software would be an asset

  • Office Suite Programs ie excel & word
  • Canada Post ESOM Software
  • Utilization of scanning equipment & software

Demonstrate full knowledge of equipment, service offerings and processes.

  • Able to detect production inconsistencies and quality issues
  • Math skills (multiplication, division, percentages)
  • Operation of PC applications in networked environment
  • Able to lift and move 50 pounds
  • Able to read, write and follow instructions
  • Listen, understand and communicate effectively
  • Willingness to learn and take direction
  • Able to work with others in a team atmosphere with minimal supervision

Finishing & Print Operator Role

This position is responsible for satisfying customer requirements for colour, black & white reprographics, and mainframe printing services within a single customer location.
Production of requested jobs on colour, black and white, large format & assorted finishing equipment.
In this role, the individual is responsible for performing printing and finishing operations / services in the production process.
This position works with other members of the production team to facilitate quality control so the Customer receives a perfect job. Assisting all customers in a manner that meets or exceeds expectations.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:
Establish and Maintain high levels of Customer Satisfaction

Operator Responsibilities
Determine output requirements, machine set-up, print and check proofs (may include scanning and minimal document manipulation), run job, remove output and deliver output.
Perform maintenance and repair of high-frequency service call areas on specified equipment to maximize customer uptime.
Clean reprographic, colour, hi-lite colour, wide format equipment and change supplies
Monitor and manage supplies
Record meter reads, process production forms and maintain records
Finishing Responsibilities
Set up and operate various specialized finishing equipment and machines that cut, fold, gather and finish brochures, magazines, books, business forms and other printed material
Operate binding equipment (e.g. paper cutters, inserter, laminating, and hole punchers)
Perform maintenance and repair to maximize customer uptime
Clean and maintain equipment
Maintain inventory

QUALIFICATIONS: (if applicable to the print shop)
Experience with the following equipment & software would be an asset

  • B&W and colour printer
  • Freeflow
  • Paper cutter
  • Paper drill
  • Autopunch
  • Autocoiler
  • Large format print & finishing equipment

Demonstrate full knowledge of equipment, service offerings and processes.

  • Able to operate large centralized digital equipment
  • Able to detect production inconsistencies and quality issues
  • Experience in finishing environment, operating finishing /binding equipment
  • Math skills (multiplication, division, percentages)
  • Operation of PC applications in networked environment
  • Able to lift and move 50 pounds
  • Able to read, write and follow instructions
  • Listen, understand and communicate effectively
  • Willingness to learn and take direction
  • Able to work with others in a team atmosphere with minimal supervision

Please note you must be legally eligible to work in Canada

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $16.00 per hour

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Calgary, AB: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Education:

  • Secondary School (preferred)

Experience:

  • administrative assistant: 1 year (preferred)
  • receptionist: 1 year (preferred)

title: Digital Mailroom Assistant (12-month contract)
description:
Job Details

Description

Your Next Opportunity

Would you like to be a part of Canada’s leading and progressive Business Law firm?

McMillan has an exciting opportunity as a Digital Mailroom Assistant (12-month contract) in our Vancouver Business Centre group. As a member of the team, you will play a key role working as part of team supporting the day-to-day operations from 9:00am to 5:00pm in the fast-paced Business Centre.

It is important to note that this role has a requirement to work onsite in the Vancouver office at all times. This role will provide support to firm members both onsite and remotely but the successful candidate will always work from the Vancouver office.

What You’ll Do

  • Responsible for administrative tasks including: sorting and digitizing incoming mail as well as courier sorting and delivery, tracking and archiving digital mail, sending e-faxes and distributing incoming e-faxes.
  • Guaranteeing successful digital imaging and data lifting is achieved by scanning and indexing documents correctly.
  • Ensuring that physical mail, which cannot be scanned is sorted appropriately for re-distribution to the appropriate area.
  • Assisting with ordering and stocking office supplies, as well as, production, collating and scanning reprographics.
  • Working on closing books and assisting with processing and saving to our electronic database.
  • Helping with tracking monthly statistics and quality checks while using your high level of customer service to respond to and resolve requests in person, on the phone or via email.
  • Monitoring mailroom equipment including troubleshooting and coordinating with external technicians.
  • Assisting the Facilities team with set up and tear down of portable boardroom furniture and audio visual equipment.
  • Assisting in office moves, preparing workspace for staff arrivals and departures.
  • Setting up virtual meetings using different platforms such as WebEx, Microsoft teams and Zoom.
  • Other administrative areas and projects as required.

What You Bring

You are at the beginning of your administrative career pursuing a new challenge. You have strong administrative, organizational and interpersonal skills. You are detail-oriented and work well in a team setting, and provide an exceptional level of client service. You thrive under pressure and are an excellent multitasker. You embrace evolving technology and have strong skills in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook and Adobe Acrobat. You are flexible to work a variety of shifts, including overtime when necessary and are able to lift up to 50 pounds. You are proactive when it comes to problem solving and strive to develop the best possible solution for the matter at hand.

McMillan Offers You

Mentorship and Support

Training as Software Evolves

Commensurate Compensation and Benefits Package

Fun Work Environment

McMillan = You

Inclusion and diversity are essential elements of our culture at McMillan which coincides with our core values of respect, teamwork, commitment, client service and professional excellence. We are extremely proud to be one of Canada’s Top Employers for Young People six years in a row.

At McMillan, we know we will achieve the most success by attracting and retaining the best talent, and by representing and supporting communities from which we draw our members, the communities in which we live and work and the communities to which we provide legal services.

We are a law firm that prides itself in sustained quality and excellence in service while fostering a positive and collegial work environment which nurtures mentoring inspires enthusiasm and professional excellence. We commit to putting our best efforts forward in achieving our goals, and the goals of our clients. You can help us in that journey!

Need another reason to consider McMillan? Let’s work together to help you achieve your professional goals and career development.

Let’s get started

If you are interested in applying for this position and you reside in or around the Vancouver area, please submit your combined resume and cover letter by clicking on the Apply Now button.

McMillan is committed to providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities in its recruitment processes. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please email us or contact us at 1.888.622.4624 to submit your accommodation request.

McMillan LLP is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and diversity. We respect and embrace the unique backgrounds, perspectives and experiences of individuals at all levels of the firm. This enables us to provide innovative client service, contribute fully to our communities and advance our firm’s values.

To protect the health and safety of our firm members, McMillan LLP has introduced a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy across all office for everyone working in or visiting the firm. As such, all offers of employment will be conditional upon providing proof of full vaccination with a COVID-19 vaccination approved by Health Canada. Any requests for exemptions will be considered on an individual basis.

title: Dames Assistant (Live out)
description:
We are looking for a motivated and passionate Dames Assistant tosupport the Dame with the pastoral care of the students, as well as supporting central teams with the day-to-day running of the House, ensuring its cleanliness, tidiness, and comfort, and that high levels of health and safety are maintained. You will have frequent contact with the students and in addition to your job role, you will be able to take an interest in the activities of the house such as sports, plays and musical productions.

You will work flexibly and collaboratively with the Dame to ensure that students needs are put first, and that you can both take appropriate rest breaks. At all times you will be a visible presence in the House when on duty. Our boarding houses are integral to the students lives, and you will have a direct impact on their experience of life at Eton College.

Due to the needs of the school and the department, we may interview suitable candidates before the closing date.This job may also close early if a large number of applications are received. You are advised to submit your application as early as possible to avoid missing your chance to apply.

Benefits

Eton College offers a wide range of benefits, includingan 11% employer contribution to your pension (with 4.9% employee contribution), Employee Assistance Programme, enhanced Maternity / Paternity scheme, free eyecare vouchers, a cycle to work scheme, subsidised lunches during term time, free access to the Colleges sport and leisure facilities and discounts at local retailers and businesses.

Main Duties
  • Develop positive relationships with the new pupils,inducting them into the ways of the house by setting expectations about cleanliness of rooms, dealing with laundry, and respecting their environment, as well as encouraging them to be polite, well mannered, friendly and presentable.
  • Supervising laundry, sending students clothing and sheets to laundry once a week; checking return of these items and reporting numbers of missing sheets and pillowcases.
  • Supervising Messing Teas, at all times ensuring that health and safety requirements are adhered to, and also taking the opportunity to get to know the pupils, set standards and to provide pastoral support.
  • Assisting the Dame with the general health and wellbeing of pupils in College, liaising with School medical staff as appropriate in order to share any health or medical concerns.
  • Escorting pupils to routine appointments at the School Health Centre or local hospitals as required, responding and providing support during medical emergencies.
  • In the absence of the Dame, liaising with parents on medical, domestic or logistic matters.
  • Supporting the Dame and House Master at functions and events.
  • Ensuring that appropriate standards of cleanliness are maintained in allocated rooms and areas of the house by cleaning in line with the expectations and standards set out by the Central Cleaning team. Your cleaning tasks, including relevant training in this area, comes under the supervision of the Housekeeping Supervisor.
  • Commitment and promotion of equality, diversity andinclusion;
  • All positions at Eton are classed as regulated activity as per the Keeping Children Safe in Education 2021 guidance, therefore a good understanding of safeguarding procedures is essential;
  • Commitment to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, including by not limited to, completing safeguarding training as required, and ensuring any safeguarding updates issued by the College are read and understood;
  • Understand and comply with procedures and legislation relating to confidentiality.
The Ideal Candidate

To Be Successful In This Role, You Will Need
  • A flexible approach to work and a can do attitude;
  • A high standard of verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to flex your style to communicate with a variety of different people;
  • The ability to nurture good working relationships with other departments;
  • The ability to work using your own initiative whilst also being happy to take direction from the Dame House Master and Housekeeping Supervisor;
  • Confidence in your own abilities and to deal with challenging situations;
  • Previous experience of handling administration and good computer skills particularly Word, Excel and Outlook;
  • An understanding of when to resolve a problem on your own, and when to ask for help.
  • The flexibility to work within a dual reporting line structure.
Ideally, You Will Also Have
  • Previous experience of working in a pastoral role for children or young adults
  • An awareness of the Childrens Act and Safeguarding and Child Protection;
  • First Aid or relevant medical training;
  • A clean and valid driving license.
About The College

We are an equal opportunities employer and are seeking applications from suitable candidates from all backgrounds.We are dedicated to creating and sustaining an environment that values individuality and difference and celebrates the diversity of both staff and pupils by fostering perseverance, tolerance and integrity. We believe in equal opportunity for everyone, irrespective of age, disability, gender, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, race, religion or belief, sexual orientation or socio-economic background.

If you have any queries about the application process or any problem with submitting your application online, the Recruitment Team will be happy to help.Should you require anyreasonable adjustmentsto be made or facilitiesprovided to enable you to apply online, please do not hesitate to contact us on so we can make adjustments accordingly.

DISCLOSURE CHECKS

Eton College is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, and applicants must be willing to undergo child protection screening appropriate to the post, including reference checks with past employers, an Enhanced Disclosure from the Disclosure and Barring Service and, where applicable, a Barred List, Prohibition and EEA checks.If you are successful in your application, you will be required to complete a DBS Disclosure Application Form. Any information disclosed will be handled in accordance with any guidance and/or Code of Practice published by the DBS. The College is exempt from the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1974 and therefore all convictions, cautions, reprimands and final warnings (including those which would normally be considered as spent under the Act) must be declared, subject to the DBS filtering rules.It is a criminal offence for any person who is barred from working with children to attempt to apply for a position at the College.

Midwest Surveys is an employee-owned professional land surveying firm providing geomatics deliverables designed for oil & gas, utility, construction and municipal applications through our ten offices in Saskatchewan, Alberta, and British Columbia.

In this position, you will be assisting a Crew Chief in performing all types of field surveying.

Survey Assistant Duties Include
  • Assisting a Crew Chief in locating property boundaries, buildings, structures and other natural or human-made features;
  • Operation of Global Positioning System (GPS), a variety of survey equipment, and off-road vehicles; and
  • Maintenance of hand and power tools, survey equipment, vehicles, and supplies.
Qualifications

If you have a willingness to learn, we will provide you with on-the-job training. The Survey Assistant will be paired with an experienced Crew Chief, providing mentorship and one-on-one training. There is an opportunity for career advancement as we continue to expand our local presence.

  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • Valid class 5 driver's license (abstract required at time of interview)
  • Willingness to work 40 hours per week (with the potential for overtime)
  • Safety training (i.e. H2S, First Aid, etc.) is required and will be provided as needed
  • Willingness and availability to work a varied schedule based on client demands. This may include working in remote locations, rotational schedules and extended work days (overtime eligible)
  • Compliance with our drug and alcohol policy, which includes screening, is mandatory
  • Physical ability to perform the requirements of the job
  • Willingness to work in all types of weather conditions
  • Knowledge in the operation of Total Station and GPS equipment considered an asset
  • Preferred candidates will have:
  • Previous Survey Assistant experience and familiarity with all facets of surveying; including well site surveys, pipeline surveys and line locating.
  • Previous experience with 4X4 trucks, all-terrain vehicles and snowmobiles
  • ATV and line locating certifications
  • Knowledge in the operation of Total Station and GPS equipment
Why Choose Midwest?

Midwest Surveys is a 100% employee-owned company that values its people! Celebrating over 70 years in the industry, we have been ranked as one of the 50 Best Employers in Canada and a Top Employer in Alberta. We have also been recognized as a top health benefits provider and have been named the Best Workplace in Alberta for Health and Safety.

Midwest Surveys actively supports local communities, charities and is committed to a high level of ethics. We pride ourselves on providing an outstanding work environment!

Midwest Surveys is an employee-owned professional land surveying firm providing geomatics deliverables designed for oil & gas, utility, construction and municipal applications through our ten offices in Saskatchewan, Alberta, and British Columbia.

Candidates should be prepared to work a minimum of 40 hours per week, with potential for overtime. Some travel may be required. You must be physically able to perform the requirements of the job and be willing to work in all types of weather conditions. Safety training (i.e. CSTS, First Aid, WHMIS, etc.) is required and will be provided as necessary. Candidates should be prepared to comply with our drug and alcohol policy, which includes screening, and should be prepared to provide a driver’s abstract at time of interview.

Midwest Surveys is a 100% employee-owned company that values its people! Celebrating over 70 years in the industry, we have been ranked as one of the 50 Best Employers in Canada.   • Assisting in office moves, preparing workspace for staff arrivals and departures.
  • Setting up virtual meetings using different platforms such as WebEx, Microsoft teams and Zoom.
  • Other administrative areas and projects as required.

What You Bring

You are at the beginning of your administrative career pursuing a new challenge. You have strong administrative, organizational and interpersonal skills. You are detail-oriented and work well in a team setting, and provide an exceptional level of client service. You thrive under pressure and are an excellent multitasker. You embrace evolving technology and have strong skills in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook and Adobe Acrobat. You are flexible to work a variety of shifts, including overtime when necessary and are able to lift up to 50 pounds. You are proactive when it comes to problem solving and strive to develop the best possible solution for the matter at hand.

McMillan Offers You

Mentorship and Support

Training as Software Evolves

Commensurate Compensation and Benefits Package

Fun Work Environment

McMillan = You

Inclusion and diversity are essential elements of our culture at McMillan which coincides with our core values of respect, teamwork, commitment, client service and professional excellence. We are extremely proud to be one of Canada’s Top Employers for Young People six years in a row.

Need another reason to consider McMillan? Let’s work together to help you achieve your professional goals and career development.

This enables us to provide innovative client service, contribute fully to our communities and advance our firm’s values.

To protect the health and safety of our firm members, McMillan LLP has introduced a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy across all office for everyone working in or visiting the firm. As such, all offers of employment will be conditional upon providing proof of full vaccination with a COVID-19 vaccination approved by Health Canada. Any requests for exemptions will be considered on an individual basis.

title: Digital Mailroom Assistant (12-month contract)
description:
Job Details

Description

Your Next Opportunity

Would you like to be a part of Canada’s leading and progressive Business Law firm?

McMillan has an exciting opportunity as a Digital Mailroom Assistant (12-month contract) in our Vancouver Business Centre group. As a member of the team, you will play a key role working as part of team supporting the day-to-day operations from 9:00am to 5:00pm in the fast-paced Business Centre.

It is important to note that this role has a requirement to work onsite in the Vancouver office at all times. This role will provide support to firm members both onsite and remotely but the successful candidate will always work from the Vancouver office.

What You’ll Do

  • Responsible for administrative tasks including: sorting and digitizing incoming mail as well as courier sorting and delivery, tracking and archiving digital mail, sending e-faxes and distributing incoming e-faxes.
  • Guaranteeing successful digital imaging and data lifting is achieved by scanning and indexing documents correctly.
  • Ensuring that physical mail, which cannot be scanned is sorted appropriately for re-distribution to the appropriate area.
  • Assisting with ordering and stocking office supplies, as well as, production, collating and scanning reprographics.
  • Working on closing books and assisting with processing and saving to our electronic database.
  • Helping with tracking monthly statistics and quality checks while using your high level of customer service to respond to and resolve requests in person, on the phone or via email.
  • Monitoring mailroom equipment including troubleshooting and coordinating with external technicians.
  • Assisting the Facilities team with set up and tear down of portable boardroom furniture and audio visual equipment.
  • Assisting in office moves, preparing workspace for staff arrivals and departures.
  • Setting up virtual meetings using different platforms such as WebEx, Microsoft teams and Zoom.
  • Other administrative areas and projects as required.

What You Bring

You are at the beginning of your administrative career pursuing a new challenge. You have strong administrative, organizational and interpersonal skills. You are detail-oriented and work well in a team setting, and provide an exceptional level of client service. You thrive under pressure and are an excellent multitasker. You embrace evolving technology and have strong skills in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook and Adobe Acrobat. You are flexible to work a variety of shifts, including overtime when necessary and are able to lift up to 50 pounds. You are proactive when it comes to problem solving and strive to develop the best possible solution for the matter at hand.

McMillan Offers You

Mentorship and Support

Training as Software Evolves

Commensurate Compensation and Benefits Package

Fun Work Environment

McMillan = You

Inclusion and diversity are essential elements of our culture at McMillan which coincides with our core values of respect, teamwork, commitment, client service and professional excellence. We are extremely proud to be one of Canada’s Top Employers for Young People six years in a row.

At McMillan, we know we will achieve the most success by attracting and retaining the best talent, and by representing and supporting communities from which we draw our members, the communities in which we live and work and the communities to which we provide legal services.

We are a law firm that prides itself in sustained quality and excellence in service while fostering a positive and collegial work environment which nurtures mentoring inspires enthusiasm and professional excellence. We commit to putting our best efforts forward in achieving our goals, and the goals of our clients. You can help us in that journey!

Need another reason to consider McMillan? Let’s work together to help you achieve your professional goals and career development.

Let’s get started

If you are interested in applying for this position and you reside in or around the Vancouver area, please submit your combined resume and cover letter by clicking on the Apply Now button.

McMillan is committed to providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities in its recruitment processes. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please email us or contact us at 1.888.622.4624 to submit your accommodation request.

McMillan LLP is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and diversity. We respect and embrace the unique backgrounds, perspectives and experiences of individuals at all levels of the firm. This enables us to provide innovative client service, contribute fully to our communities and advance our firm’s values.

To protect the health and safety of our firm members, McMillan LLP has introduced a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy across all office for everyone working in or visiting the firm. As such, all offers of employment will be conditional upon providing proof of full vaccination with a COVID-19 vaccination approved by Health Canada. Any requests for exemptions will be considered on an individual basis.

title: Harvest Assistants
description:
A dream in the making…


We are Mavericks: uncompromising in our pursuit of making exceptional wine and committed to sustainable and natural practices.

Maverick Estate Winery is located on the Golden Mile Slopes between Oliver and Osoyoos and for the past decade has been making some of the most exciting wines in Canada.  Family-owned and operated, we are a tight-knit team that creates sensational, minimal intervention wines and welcoming relaxed visitor experiences.

Maverick Estate is a 125T winery in the South Okanagan of beautiful British Columbia. Situated on the eastern edge of the Cascade Range, Maverick lies within the northern reaches of the Sonora desert, giving it a beautiful and enviable position of a dry climate and big diurnal swings. This results in a beautiful range of terroirs allowing for both full-bodied wines as well as those with natural bright acidity and freshness. At Maverick we incorporate low intervention techniques in the cellar and vineyard, allowing for the grapes and sites to express themselves. We are looking for a few qualified candidates to join our multinational and multicultural team. You will be involved in all aspects of the winemaking process and we look forward to learning as much from you as you will from us. 


Qualifications:


  • 2 previous harvest experiences are preferred, international harvest work is a bonus
  • College-level certification in cellar/vineyard is great, Degree in Oenology or Viticulture is even better
  • Ability to communicate in English at a minimum, French and Spanish even better
  • Ability to work hard, long hours, desire to learn and be part of a fun team a must
  • Eligibility to work in Canada must be in place to qualify


Job Description:


  • All aspects of harvest work at a 125T winery
  • Cleaning, picking, sorting, pressing, cleaning, racking, transfers, barrel work, cleaning, cap management, digging out red fermenters etc.
  • Tasting and sensory assessment of fruit, juice, fermentations and wine

 

Are you ready to be a Maverick? We’d love to hear from you.  

Email a covering letter telling us about your past experience and how it would make you a great addition to our team plus your resume to:  

Andrew Windsor, Co-Owner & Winemaker

description:
At GeoVerra, it’s about more than surveying land. Joining our team means you’ll step into a career with wide-open opportunities. Experience new places, challenges that grow you, and a dynamic pace of work in which two days are never the same. If you’re most at home in the outdoors—where fresh air, towering trees and occasional wildlife become your second-favourite coworkers—then our Survey Assistant position might be the perfect fit.

Our company is in acceleration mode. GeoVerra’s growth is based on real partnerships, and we credit it to the people and culture that make us who we are to set us apart. In fact, your career here will be unique to you, and that’s how we like it. We value your sharp skills, creative mind, and technical brain.

The most important thing to know? We’re a team of experienced and professional employees who genuinely believe in the work we do. We support each other in a safe and positive working environment. At GeoVerra, you never go at it alone. Dig deeper. Broaden your horizons. We’re here for it all. And with fantastic benefits, work-life balance, and professional development options, we make it easier to chase your dreams.

The Partnership Promise

This is our commitment to provide responsive, trustworthy, industry expertise and a solutions-oriented approach to our clients, but we extend this way of thinking in all we do. It shows up in the form of work ethic, teamwork, safety and support for our GeoVerra family.

You + GeoVerra

Our new Survey Assistant, located in Bonnyville, AB must be passionate about spending time in the field. Whether you have a technical background or love exploring every nook and cranny outside, you should have an unquenchable thirst for seeing and doing it all.

This position requires a quick and engaged learner, with proven success in adaptability, productivity and high physical capabilities. Ideally, you are organized and highly collaborative, with strong communication skills and an infectious positivity that encourages this attitude in all team members. You will have a strong handle on equipment and field tools, with a healthy respect for the outdoors and the timeline of the task at hand.

Key Responsibilities
  • Arrive at work on time and prepared for the task and shift assigned by the Field Crew Coordinator.
  • Support a positive and professional team atmosphere and acts as a positive ambassador for the company in all situations where there is contact with the public, our clients or potential clients and project contractors.
  • Assist with various tasks including but not limited to organization and housekeeping of tools, equipment and materials at project sites, office and in crew vehicles.
  • Assist the Crew Chief in achieving project timelines and deliverables.
  • Participate proactively in completing required internal and external safety training and practicing competent operation of all types of survey related equipment and vehicles required for the task at hand.
  • Adhere to the safety requirements of the client, OH&S and the GeoVerra Safety program on all projects.
  • Participate in Emergency Response Planning, Hazard Assessment, Job Safety Analysis development, daily tailgate meetings and complies with all safety activities identified.
Required Skills And Behaviours
  • Diploma or Degree in Geomatics Engineering Technology, Civil Engineering Technology, or related discipline preferred.
  • Drivers license is required.
  • Previous experience in Surveying or other related types of work involving the outdoors.
  • Ability to take direction and communicate effectively.
  • An understanding of survey methodologies is considered an asset.
  • Ability to work effectively and competently with people at all levels in the organization; is a great team member.
  • Ability to work without supervision; effective time management and strong organizational skills.
  • Working knowledge of MS Office including Excel and Outlook. Working knowledge and familiarity with AutoCAD software an asset.
  • Ability and willingness to travel for the client, project, and GeoVerra requirements and to respond to situations that occur outside traditional working hours.
  • Adaptable and able to think outside the box.
Timeline

Full time, beginning immediately

At this time GeoVerra does not mandate COVID-19 vaccine for employees. With that, many GeoVerra clients have incorporated proof of vaccine practices due to COVID-19 and this may require you to provide proof of immunization when accessing their sites.

GeoVerra has every intention of fostering diversity within and across our organization. title: Assistant (CMX - 002)
description:
Position Overview


We are seeking a career-motivated individual to join our team in our brand-new Comox office. As an Assistant, the incumbent will contribute to growing the business by providing support to the Investment Advisors and team, ensuring high-level client service, and effective functioning of the team through administration-related tasks.


Accountabilities and Responsibilities


Team Support:

  • Responsible for the professional servicing of incoming telephone and email contacts from clients, Advisors and other internal and external partners
  • Assist the team by preparing account documentation including client reviews, presentations, correspondence and reports
  • Assist with the design and execution of communications programs for the team, including marketing and social media
  • Assist with creating and planning client events and programs.


Client Service:

  • Foster and support client relationships
  • Respond efficiently and effectively to requests for information from clients
  • Investigate and resolve inquiries related to accounts
  • Request information and documentation from clients in order to open accounts and keep client files up to date
  • Follow up on client transfers, trades, and other activities to ensure timely conclusions


Administration:

  • Adhere to professional practices and standards, as well as internal processes and controls
  • General office management such as coordination of vendors, reorder/restock supplies and stationery
  • Maintain expense records and spreadsheets
  • General administrative office duties as required


Qualifications

  • Superior client relationship management skills
  • Demonstrate a professional and friendly manner
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
  • Relevant experience in the financial sector and/or administrative experience
  • Excellent proficiency with Microsoft Office particularly Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook
  • Experience with Client Relationship Management (CRM) systems such as Maximizer
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Meticulous attention to detail
  • Ability to prioritize, multitask, work within time constraints and follow-up
  • Ability to work in a team environment
  • Ability to quickly learn new technologies and programs and assist with team training
  • Ability to troubleshoot technology issues if they arise and assist the team in effective, efficient use of technology to best serve clients
  • Motivated to advance your career with additional courses as needed


Education


  • Post-secondary education is an asset
  • Completion of the Canadian Securities Course (CSC) and the Conduct and Practices Handbook Course (CPH) would also be of added value


The Opportunity


  • Become part of a highly qualified Wealth Management Team in one of Canada’s largest independent Wealth Management Firms, Richardson Wealth Limited.
  • This strong Canadian brand is backed by over seven generations of entrepreneurial success that influence all aspects of the business. https://www.richardsonwealth.com/us
  • That entrepreneurial history makes for a supportive, innovative culture with trust and integrity as the cornerstones of our business. https://www.richardsonwealth.com/the-name-on-the-door
  • Committed to diversity, inclusion and belonging https://rfcapgroup.com/Annual-Reports/2021/Diversity-Inclusion-and-Belonging
  • Richardson Wealth is transforming our overall digital capabilities to enhance both our employee and client experience, reducing administrative time to free teams up to deepen client relationships and build the practice.
  • Demonstrated dedication to the Comox Valley Richardson Wealth team and clients with a new, modern, and welcoming facility.


It’s an exciting time to grow with Richardson Wealth! See our growth strategy in our 2021 Annual Report https://rfcapgroup.com/Portals/0/InvestorRelations/AnnualReportsPDFs/RFC_AR_Full_2021_1.pdf
